intro: Pedicularis leucodon var. bosniaca, commonly known as the Bosnian beardroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive hooded structure that resembles a beard, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas.
